Class Department

  • java.lang.Object
    • Department

  • public class Department
extends java.lang.Object
    A treatment Department (operating theatre, X-ray room, ER bed, Ultrasound, etc) Each department has - A name, - A maximum number of patients that can be treated at the same time - A Set of Patients that are currently being treated - A Queue of Patients waiting to be treated. FOR THE CORE AND COMPLETION, YOU CAN COMPLETE THE METHODS HERE, BUT DO NOT MODIFY ANY OF THE CODE THAT IS GIVEN!!!

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Department(java.lang.String name, int max)
      Construct a new Department object Initialise the waiting queue and the current Set.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPatient(Patient p)
      A new patient for the department.
      java.util.Collection<Patient> getCurrentPatients()
      Return the collection of patients currently being treated Note: returns it as an unmodifiable collection - the calling code can step through the Patients, can call methods on the Patients, but can't add new patients to the set or remove patients from the set.
      java.util.Collection<Patient> getWaitingPatients()
      Return the collection of patients waiting in the department Note: returns it as an unmodifiable collection - the calling code can step through the Patients, but can't add to them or remove them.
      void moveFromWaiting()
      Move patients off the wait queue (if any) into the set of patients being treated (if there is space - fewer than the maximum)
      void redraw(double y)
      Draw the department: the patients being treated and the patients waiting
      void removePatient(Patient p)
      Move patient out of the department

      • addPatient

        public void addPatient(Patient p)
        A new patient for the department. Always starts by being put on the wait queue.

      • getCurrentPatients

        public java.util.Collection<Patient> getCurrentPatients()
        Return the collection of patients currently being treated Note: returns it as an unmodifiable collection - the calling code can step through the Patients, can call methods on the Patients, but can't add new patients to the set or remove patients from the set.

      • getWaitingPatients

        public java.util.Collection<Patient> getWaitingPatients()
        Return the collection of patients waiting in the department Note: returns it as an unmodifiable collection - the calling code can step through the Patients, but can't add to them or remove them.

      • moveFromWaiting

        public void moveFromWaiting()
        Move patients off the wait queue (if any) into the set of patients being treated (if there is space - fewer than the maximum)

        public void redraw(double y)
        Draw the department: the patients being treated and the patients waiting
